data.title: Traders talk MAGA stocks and the state of the tech sector
Ripple sues YouTube over cryptocurrency scams
data.text: Blockchain firm Ripple sued Alphabet Inc's YouTube on Tuesday, alleging the video-sharing platform failed to protect consumers from cryptocurrency "giveaway" scams that use fake social media profiles to dupe victims into sending money.

data.title: Senator asks Google and Apple CEOs to be personally liable for COVID-19 tracking project privacy
data.text: The tracing tech poses "serious concerns" in privacy, Sen. Hawley says.

data.title: Apple and Google CEOs should be held responsible for protecting coronavirus tracking data, says GOP Sen. Hawley
data.text: The companies have teamed up to release tools allowing developers to create apps notifying users who if they have come into contact with someone who has tested positive.

data.title: The Ratings Game: Google, Facebook stocks take a beating after analysts cut outlooks on internet advertising
data.text: Shares of Google parent Alphabet Inc. and Facebook Inc. were hit hard Tuesday, as part of a broad technology-sector selloff, after Wall Street analysts cut their price targets and warned about further weakness in online advertising sales.

data.title: Australia Vs. Alphabet And Facebook: David Vs. Vs. Twin Goliaths
data.text: The Australian Federal Treasurer has announced plans to take on the tech titans, Google and Facebook, to force them to pay Australian media companies for publishing their stories.

data.title: Google wanted to partner with delivery companies to compete with Amazon
data.text: The move is the latest effort by Google to reinvigorate its Shopping service. By adopting a system akin to Amazon's, Google is hoping more merchants will put their products on its service

data.title: Alphabet (GOOGL) Expands Coronavirus Screener Availability
data.text: Alphabet (GOOGL) Verily's COVID-19 screener is now available in Michigan and Ohio.

data.title: 3 Stocks to Buy for a Quick Post-Coronavirus Turnaround
data.text: These three stocks look like they'll bounce back quickly following the coronavirus crisis, making them hot stocks to buy now.

data.title: 4 Gaming Stocks Making Headlines During the Coronavirus Lockdown
data.text: People in isolation are turning to video games for entertainment and interaction, which is good news for gaming stocks.

data.title: Alphabet’s Loon deploys internet connectivity balloons to Kenya for first commercial service launch
data.text: Alphabet-owned Loon, the high-altitude broadband connectivity company for hard-to-reach places, has launched the first balloons that will provide its first ever commercial connectivity services to Kenyans following the approval of its service deployment by the government of Kenya a couple of weeks ago. The balloons are now in testing, but pending the results of those […]

data.title: Google drops charges on shopping service to counter Amazon's surging ad sales
data.text: Google said on Tuesday it would stop charging merchants to place products on its Google Shopping search page as it looks to win e-commerce advertising business from Amazon.com Inc and other online retailers, just as they are struggling to supply customers with some items due to the coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: Google makes it free for sellers to list items on its shopping platform
data.text: The search giant makes a bigger push into shopping amid the coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: France urges Apple and Google to ease privacy rules on contact tracing
data.text: Government becomes first to call for invasive measures in effort to combat coronavirus

data.title: Google Hangouts vs. Zoom: Which video chat app is better during quarantine?
data.text: Coronavirus has many people staying home and connecting with friends and coworkers through video chat. Here are two options for staying in touch.
